result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Parties are still working towards an agreement. DE given notice in hand for the next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

CT found PC this defn committed a felony and bound over to branch . Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

2:25 PM Defendant David J Smith in court.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for David J Smith.  ADA Tess Lewandowski appeared for Carl Jacob Lazarus for State of Wisconsin. Off J Nickel duly sworn and testified.  Direct Exam by ADA. Venue established. Witness identification. Cross Exam by Atty Windham. Witness excused. State moves for bind over, waived argument, reserve rebuttal. Defn objected to bind over. Argument by Atty Windham.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
02:03 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Devonte D Windham.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Joan H. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 300 block of Juniper Dr in Marshall. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any pets. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:30 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Guy Cardamone.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
